title: NZ women's firefighter calendar raises $100K for breast cancer charity | ABC NEWS
description: New Zealand's first all-female professional firefighter calendar has sold out its first run and raised $100,000 for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer.   Thirteen firefighters from 9 stations and 4 cities fill the calendar’s pages, with the campaign also carrying a deep personal meaning for many of the women involved with some of their family members and friends affected by the disease.  "A few of the girls from the calendar and throughout firefighting have had close connections with breast cancer, it just felt really fitting,” co-organiser Zoe Feau told New Zealand morning show Breakfast.  In an industry largely dominated by men, the idea for the fundraiser was sparked by career firefighter and Wāhine Toa Firefighter Calendar co-organiser, Nicole Koch.  The Wahine Toa Firefighter Calendar's Instagram page has amassed 75,000 followers after posting previews over the past two months. “We've been getting messages from all around the world. People are really, excited and want to buy the calendar. It's actually been really overwhelming,” said Koch.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation.
